page.title: 09THE RIVER TRENT
page.content: The{River Trent}flows through the section diagonally from SW to NE with a lock beside{Nabbs Island}near{ {Hazelford Ferry.}It is a fast-flowing river with a small wooded escarpment on the SE bank. Where the river winds away from the escarpment, it leaves a considerable area subject to flooding. The river bed is regularly dredged to a depth of at least 8 feet, and down to 17 feet in places. The dredged material is taken by barge to {Gunthorpe,}washed, graded and sold as aggregate which is used for making roads. The{Trent}was once a very busy commercial waterway, but this traffic has virtually ceased. It is now used by pleasure craft particularly in the summer months when up to 300 craft per week pass through the lock.
